OVERVIEW: The Olathe series consists of shallow, well drained soils that formed in residuum from sandstone.  Olathe soils are on plateau and mesa tops with slopes of 1 to 15 percent.  The mean annual precipitation is about 640 mm and the mean annual air temperature is about 3 degrees C.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Loamy, mixed, superactive Lithic Haplocryepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Olathe fine sandy loam, spruce-fir woodland (colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
Oe--0 to 5 cm; partially decomposed organic material mainly needles, bark, twigs and leaves.
A--5 to 15 cm; pinkish gray (7.5YR 6/2) fine sandy loam, brown (7.5YR 4/2) moist; weak fine granular structure; soft, very friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; common very fine and fine roots; 5 percent gravel, 5 percent cobble; slightly acid (pH 6.4); clear smooth boundary (3 to 13 cm thick).
Bw--15 to 30 cm; light brown (7.5YR 6/4) fine sandy loam, brown (7.5YR 4/4) moist; weak very fine and fine subangular blocky structure; soft, very friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; common very fine and fine roots; 5 percent gravel, 5 percent cobble; slightly acid (pH 6.2); clear wavy boundary (13 to 25 cm thick).
C--30 to 43 cm; pink (7.5YR 7/4) cobbly fine sandy loam, brown (7.5YR 5/4) moist; massive; soft, very friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; few very fine and fine roots; 5 percent gravel, 10 percent cobble; moderately acid (pH 5.8); clear wavy boundary (10 to 20 cm thick).
Cr--43 to 48 cm; strongly weathered sandstone.
R--48 cm; hard sandstone.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Montrose County, Colorado, the southwest quarter of the northwest quarter in sec.  20, T. 47 N., R. 12 W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Mean annual soil temperature--2 to 4 degrees C
Mean summer soil temperature--6 to 8 degrees C
Depth to lithic contact--15 to 50 cm
Particle-size control section:
Rock fragment content--0 to 20 percent and are mainly gravel and cobbles
A horizon
Hue--10YR through 7.5YR
Value--5 or 6, 3 or 4 moist
Chroma--2 through 4
Reaction--pH 6.1 to 7.3
Bw horizon
Hues--10YR or 5YR
Value--6 or 7, 4 or 5 moist
Chroma--3 through 6
Clay content--10 to 20 percent
Reaction--pH 6.1 to 7.3
C horizon, when present
Hues--10YR or 5YR
Value--7 or 8, 6 or 7 moist
Chroma--3 through 6
Texture--cobbly fine sandy loam, sandy loam or cobbly sandy loam
Reaction--pH 5.6 to 7.3

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  Currently there are no competing series in this family.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Landform--plateau and mesa tops
Elevation--2750 to 3050 meters
Slope--1 to 15 percent
Parent material--residuum derived from sandstone
Mean annual precipitation--610 to 710 mm
Mean annual air temperature--1 to 4 degrees C

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; slow runoff; moderately rapid permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  The soil is used for timber production and range.  Vegetation is Engelmann spruce-Subalpine fir woodland with an understory of elk sedge, slender wheatgrass, nodding bromegrass, meadow rue and snowberry.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Olathe soils are of small extent on the Uncompahgre Plateau of western Colorado; MLRA 35.

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (SSRO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content: SERIES PROPOSED:  Uncompahgre Area, Colorado, Soil Survey Area #8676, 1982.

REMARKS.content: REMARKS:  Converted to metric and O horizons were updated to start at zero. Competing series section was not updated. 02/2023

HORIZONS.name: Oe
HORIZONS.narrative: Oe--0 to 5 cm; partially decomposed organic material mainly needles, bark, twigs and leaves.

HORIZONS.name: A
HORIZONS.narrative: A--5 to 15 cm; pinkish gray (7.5YR 6/2) fine sandy loam, brown (7.5YR 4/2) moist; weak fine granular structure; soft, very friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; common very fine and fine roots; 5 percent gravel, 5 percent cobble; slightly acid (pH 6.4); clear smooth boundary (3 to 13 cm thick).

HORIZONS.name: Bw
HORIZONS.structure: weak very fine and fine subangular blocky
HORIZONS.narrative: Bw--15 to 30 cm; light brown (7.5YR 6/4) fine sandy loam, brown (7.5YR 4/4) moist; weak very fine and fine subangular blocky structure; soft, very friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; common very fine and fine roots; 5 percent gravel, 5 percent cobble; slightly acid (pH 6.2); clear wavy boundary (13 to 25 cm thick).

HORIZONS.name: C
HORIZONS.narrative: C--30 to 43 cm; pink (7.5YR 7/4) cobbly fine sandy loam, brown (7.5YR 5/4) moist; massive; soft, very friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; few very fine and fine roots; 5 percent gravel, 10 percent cobble; moderately acid (pH 5.8); clear wavy boundary (10 to 20 cm thick).

HORIZONS.name: Cr
HORIZONS.narrative: Cr--43 to 48 cm; strongly weathered sandstone.
